Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in excluding the principal applicant under Article 1E and failed to assess family's claim
Application_Facts: Principal applicant never resided in Greece; married to a Greek citizen; feared persecution in Sudan
Claimant_Status: Principal applicant and family seeking refugee status
Defendant_Behavior: Board excluded applicant under Article 1E without proper assessment
Legal_Standard: Ward principle: asylum-seekers must prove risk of persecution in all countries of nationality
Assessment_Factor: Residency in country of claimed nationality
Procedural_Issue: Failure to separately assess family members' claims
Evidence_Used: Marriage to Greek citizen, lack of residence in Greece, fear of persecution in Sudan
Application_Basis: Exclusion based on assumed nationality rights due to marriage
Evidence_Assessed: Residency, nationality ties, risk in country of origin
Governing_Rule: Individuals with rights/obligations of nationality are excluded from refugee status
Evidentiary_Deficiency: No evidence of actual nationality or residence in Greece
Cause_Description: Principal applicant feared persecution in Sudan but was excluded under Article 1E due to marriage to a Greek citizen despite no residency in Greece
Evidence_Handling: Insufficient consideration of actual nationality obligations
Evidence_Issues: Lack of proof of effective nationality
Residency_Compliance: Principal applicant never resided in Greece
Jurisdictional_Issue: Application of exclusion clause to non-resident spouse
Evidence_Assessment: Board failed to assess whether applicant had actual rights/obligations of Greek nationality
Decision_Rationale: Article 1E does not apply without actual nationality rights or residence
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to assess individual claims of family members
